%md

# Music Recommendator

msg.data: Music Recommendator

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Preparing the Data

Let's start by downloading the data :

msg.data:
Preparing the Data

Let’s start by downloading the data :

paragraphs.text:
%sh
cd /data
if [[ ! -f profiledata_06-May-2005.tar.xz ]]
then 
    echo "Downloading profiledata_06-May-2005.tar.xz"
    curl --silent https://drive.switch.ch/index.php/s/gK6l44wTWixlaeC/download -o profiledata_06-May-2005.tar.xz
fi
tar xfv profiledata_06-May-2005.tar.xz
ls -lhF profiledata_06-May-2005

paragraphs.text:
%md
Next, read the user artist data and transform it in a Dataframe with two columns "user" and "artist" :

msg.data: Next, read the user artist data and transform it in a Dataframe with two columns “user” and “artist” :

paragraphs.text:
%spark
val rawUserArtistData = spark.read.textFile("/data/profiledata_06-May-2005/user_artist_data.txt")
rawUserArtistData.take(5).foreach(println)

val userArtistDF = rawUserArtistData.map { line => 
    val Array(user, artist, _*) = line.split(' ')
    (user.toInt, artist.toInt)
}.toDF("user", "artist")
userArtistDF.printSchema
userArtistDF.agg(min("user"), max("user"), min("artist"), max("artist")).show()

paragraphs.text:
%md
Next, read the raw artist data and transform it in a Dataframe with two columns "id" and "name" :

msg.data: Next, read the raw artist data and transform it in a Dataframe with two columns “id” and “name” :

rawArtistData: org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset[String] = [value: string]
artistByID: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [id: int, name: string]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Next, read the alias artist data and transform it in a Map with artist id for the key and alias for value :

msg.data: Next, read the alias artist data and transform it in a Map with artist id for the key and alias for value :

paragraphs.text:
%spark

import org.apache.spark.sql._
import org.apache.spark.broadcast._

// Cleaning data in bonus

/**
 * Convert count musics to approximatively years of listening
 */
def countToYear(count: Int): Boolean = {
    val avgSongMinutesLength = 4.0
    avgSongMinutesLength * count.toDouble / 60.0 / 24.0 / 365.0 < 2
}
 
def buildCounts(rawUserArtistData: Dataset[String], bArtistAlias: Broadcast[Map[Int,Int]]): DataFrame = {
    val unknownId = artistByID.filter($"name" === "[unknown]").select($"id").head.getInt(0)
    val userArtistCleanedDF = userArtistDF.filter($"artist" !== unknownId)
    
    rawUserArtistData.map { line =>
        val Array(userID, artistID, count) = line.split(' ').map(_.toInt)
        val finalArtistID = bArtistAlias.value.getOrElse(artistID, artistID)
        (userID, finalArtistID, count)
    }.toDF("user", "artist", "count").filter($"artist" !== unknownId)
}
val bArtistAlias = spark.sparkContext.broadcast(artistAlias)
val trainData = buildCounts(rawUserArtistData, bArtistAlias).filter($"count" < 400000)
trainData.orderBy(desc("count")).show
trainData.cache()

%md
## Compute Dataframe with user id, artist id, artist name and count

msg.data: Compute Dataframe with user id, artist id, artist name and count

paragraphs.text:
%spark
val userArtistNamesCountDF = 
    trainData
    .join(artistByID, artistByID("id") === trainData("artist"))
    .select("user", "artist", "name", "count")
userArtistNamesCountDF.cache
userArtistNamesCountDF.show

%md
## Get most listened artists

msg.data: Get most listened artists

paragraphs.text:
%spark
val listenedArtistsDF = userArtistNamesCountDF.groupBy("artist").agg(sum("count"))
listenedArtistsDF.cache

val mostListenedArtistsDF = listenedArtistsDF.sort(desc("count"))
mostListenedArtistsDF.show

%md
## Building a First Model

msg.data: Building a First Model

paragraphs.text:
%spark
import org.apache.spark.ml.recommendation._
import scala.util.Random

val model = new ALS().
    setSeed(Random.nextLong()).
    setImplicitPrefs(true).
    setRank(10).
    setRegParam(0.01).
    setAlpha(1.0).
    setMaxIter(5).
    setUserCol("user").
    setItemCol("artist").
    setRatingCol("count").
    setPredictionCol("prediction").
    fit(trainData)

paragraphs.text:
%spark
model.userFactors.show(1, truncate = false)

%md
## Spot Checking Recommendations

msg.data: Spot Checking Recommendations

paragraphs.text:
%spark
val userID = 1059637
val existingArtistIDs = trainData.filter($"user" === userID).select("artist").as[Int].collect()
artistByID.filter($"id" isin (existingArtistIDs:_*)).show()

%spark
def makeRecommendations(model: ALSModel, userID: Int, howMany: Int): DataFrame = {
    val toRecommend = model.itemFactors.select($"id".as("artist")).withColumn("user", lit(userID))
    model.transform(toRecommend).select("artist", "prediction").orderBy($"prediction".desc).limit(howMany)
}

val topRecommendations = makeRecommendations(model, userID, 5)
topRecommendations.show()

makeRecommendations: (model: org.apache.spark.ml.recommendation.ALSModel, userID: Int, howMany: Int)org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame
topRecommendations: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [artist: int, prediction: float]

paragraphs.text:
%spark
val recommendedArtistIDs = topRecommendations.select("artist").as[Int].collect()
artistByID.filter($"id" isin (recommendedArtistIDs:_*)).show()
